main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed over Albany, New York on 14 July 1951, descending and ascending, maneuvering for approximately five minutes, and appearing larger and brighter than an ordinary aircraft.
interesting points: The object was observed to descend and ascend, exhibiting maneuvering capability not typical of conventional aircraft.
It appeared to be larger and much brighter than ordinary aircraft.
The observation lasted for approximately five minutes, allowing for a detailed study of the object's behavior.
The report indicates the existence of photographs of the aerial phenomenon.
The Office of Special Investigations did not contemplate any investigative action, suggesting that the object was not deemed to be a security threat at the time.
witnesses: Mr. Paul J. Saunier, Jr., and members of his family
